bug.author: sid-sundrani
bug.summary: reinforce_learn_qnet ArgumentError when running through command line
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I'm running reinforce_learn_qnet in pl_examples through the command line. When I run python reinforce_learn_Qnet.py, I get an argument conflicting options error: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "reinforce_learn_Qnet.py", line 428, in <module> parser = DQNLightning.add_model_specific_args(parser) File "reinforce_learn_Qnet.py", line 387, in add_model_specific_args parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(parents=[parent_parser]) File "C:\Users\Sidhant\AppData\Local\Programs\Miniconda3\envs\torch\lib\argparse.py", line 1678, in __init__ self._add_container_actions(parent) File "C:\Users\Sidhant\AppData\Local\Programs\Miniconda3\envs\torch\lib\argparse.py", line 1447, in _add_container_actions group_map.get(action, self)._add_action(action) File "C:\Users\Sidhant\AppData\Local\Programs\Miniconda3\envs\torch\lib\argparse.py", line 1577, in _add_action action = super(_ArgumentGroup, self)._add_action(action) File "C:\Users\Sidhant\AppData\Local\Programs\Miniconda3\envs\torch\lib\argparse.py", line 1387, in _add_action self._check_conflict(action) File "C:\Users\Sidhant\AppData\Local\Programs\Miniconda3\envs\torch\lib\argparse.py", line 1526, in _check_conflict conflict_handler(action, confl_optionals) File "C:\Users\Sidhant\AppData\Local\Programs\Miniconda3\envs\torch\lib\argparse.py", line 1535, in _handle_conflict_error raise ArgumentError(action, message % conflict_string) argparse.ArgumentError: argument -h/--help: conflicting option strings: -h, --help </denchmark-code>
imagenet.py in pl_examples runs perfectly fine though through the command line for me. The script passes a add_help=False argument . When I add the same add_help argument to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/019e4ff8cddadfde4d3bd48b4e8b8d294950ca2a/pl_examples/domain_templates/reinforce_learn_Qnet.py#L427>reinforce_learn_qnet</denchmark-link> it works without the argument error for me <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1WKmHMmpXpzd75i4rqyMAKO_HHo_tA5oK?usp=sharing>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1WKmHMmpXpzd75i4rqyMAKO_HHo_tA5oK?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>! pip install pytorch-lightning ! git clone https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning.git ! python pytorch-lightning/pl_examples/domain_templates/reinforce_learn_Qnet.py </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code> - PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.6.0 - OS (e.g., Linux): Windows 10 - How you installed PyTorch (`conda`, `pip`, source): Conda - Python version: 3.7.3 </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Hm is it duplicate? I fixed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/issues/5381>#5381</denchmark-link> and it didn't fix this. I think this issue is different

But actually yes, after I fixed this, it still didn't run through the command line until I also fixed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/issues/5381>#5381</denchmark-link>
